title: Calories in a Latte
meta_description: Discover calories in a latte, including full nutrition breakdown for a standard 8 oz serving with whole milk, plus tweaks and FAQs for variations.
assumptions: Standard 8 oz cafe latte: 1 shot espresso, steamed whole milk, no added sugar or flavors.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by milk type, size, cafe recipe, and additions like syrups. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard 8 oz latte with whole milk has about 150 kcal and 8 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use skim milk instead of whole

faqs.q: How many calories in a latte with whole milk?
faqs.a: About 150 kcal for an 8 oz standard latte.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a latte?
faqs.a: Around 8 g from the milk in a standard serving.

faqs.q: Do lattes have a lot of sugar?
faqs.a: Plain lattes have natural milk sugars (~12 g); flavored ones add more.

faqs.q: Calories in a skim milk latte?
faqs.a: Lower at ~100 kcal, with less fat but similar carbs.

faqs.q: How does latte size affect calories?
faqs.a: A 12 oz latte has ~225 kcal with whole milk; scale by volume.
